title: Update the Readme file to include how to build the MacOS and Android apps
description:
Debug APK

cd android
./gradlew assembleDebug

The APK will be at: android/app/build/outputs/apk/debug/app-debug.apk

Release APK

cd android
./gradlew assembleRelease

The APK will be at: android/app/build/outputs/apk/release/app-release.apk

Option 1: Using Xcode (Recommended)

Open the project in Xcode:

open mac/ClipSync.xcodeproj

Select your signing team in the project settings if needed

Press ⌘B to build or ⌘R to build and run

When I open the project in Xcode, the firebase-ios-sdk is auto installed as a project dependency. Is this needed?

Option 2: Using Command Line

You can build from the terminal using xcodebuild:

cd mac
xcodebuild -project ClipSync.xcodeproj -scheme ClipSync -configuration Release build

Or for a debug build:

cd mac
xcodebuild -project mac/ClipSync.xcodeproj -scheme ClipSync -configuration Debug build

title: Fix the MacOS build
description: Run the build commands and fix the errors
acceptance_criteria: Run `xcodebuild -project ClipSync.xcodeproj -scheme ClipSync -configuration Debug build` without build fail

title: Update the menu in the MacOS app to clearly identify that it is a different version than the original ClipSync firebase app
Look into whether Server region config is needed
description: I think this is a remnant of the firebase project. I'm based in the US so I don't need any other server. And I'm just using this app for myself.
